a_rule.message: A record resolves to a private IP
a_rule.insight: This IP is meant for internal networks. If it's publicly exposed, it may indicate a misconfiguration or internal host leak.
Having multiple IPv4 addresses usually means traffic is being load balanced or routed through a CDN. Make sure all servers are secure and configured consistently.

aaaa_rule.insight: Multiple IPv6 addresses indicate load balancing. Ensure all backend servers are properly secured and configured consistently.

mx_rule.message: Emails may be delivered to any of these servers for load balancing.
mx_rule.insight: Multiple MX servers with the same priority are used for distributing email load. Ensure they are all secure and properly configured.

mx_rule.message: Multiple MX records with different priorities
mx_rule.insight: Emails will go to the lowest-priority server first. Check that all mail servers are properly secured to avoid misdelivery or abuse.
The domain may not be configured to receive email. If email is expected, add proper MX records and secure them.

ns_rule.message: Default or ISP-provided name servers in use
ns_rule.insight: Using default DNS servers can make it easier for attackers to manipulate your domain. Consider managed DNS providers and enable DNSSEC.

soa_rule.insight: Verify the SOA record is correct with accurate contact and serial info to maintain DNS integrity.

txt_rule.insight: TXT records may contain SPF, DKIM, or other policies. Make sure they are correct to prevent email spoofing or misconfigurations.

cname_rule.insight: CNAME records point one domain to another. Ensure they are correct and do not expose internal hostnames.

defaults.insight: No issues detected based on existing rules. Review records manually to confirm correct configuration and intended exposure.
